sections.name: Department of Health Government of Western Australia
CONSENT FORM FOR MINOR SKIN PROCEDURE/ S

fields.label: Med Rec. No:

groups.label: Surname:
Forename:

that a skin lesion excision and/or split/ full thickness skin graft (delete as appropriate) will be needed:

Excision of a skin lesion means cutting away a suspicious skin abnormality. This may be done under a local, regional or general anaesthetic. If the area to be removed is small, the wound may be closed with stitches.
These are the commoner risks. There may be other unusual risks that have not been listed here. Please ask your plastic surgeon if you have any general or specific concerns.
I understand the following are possible significant risks and complications specific to my individual circumstances, that I have considered in deciding I will have this operation:
■ I acknowledge the plastic surgeon has informed me about the procedure, alternative treatments and answered my specific queries and concerns about this matter.
Signature of patient
Date
If the patient is an adult and unable to give consent, a proxy form must be completed and attached
■ I declare that I have explained to the patient the nature of their condition, the procedure to be performed, and discussed the risks that particularly concern the patient.

fields.labelPrefix: The doctor has explained that I, (name of patient)
fields.name: p_full_name

fields.label: that a skin lesion excision and/or split/ full thickness skin graft (delete as appropriate) will be needed:

Excision of a skin lesion means cutting away a suspicious skin abnormality. This may be done under a local, regional or general anaesthetic. If the area to be removed is small, the wound may be closed with stitches.

A skin graft means using a thin layer of skin taken from elsewhere on the body to cover a defect. Under a local or general anaesthetic, the recipient site is prepared. The skin graft is then taken and placed over the defect. It may be held in place with stitches for a few days. The graft is held in place with a special layered dressing to reduce the risk of shearing forces and of fluid collections lifting the graft.

groups.label: For a split skin graft, the raw donor site (often the thigh) is dressed and allowed to heal spontaneously. For a full thickness skin graft, the donor site (often behind the ear or from the groin area) may be closed with stitches or occasionally may itself require a split skin graft to heal.
I understand there are risks associated with any anaesthetic (see separate Anaesthetic Consent Form).
I may have side effects from any of the drugs used. The commoner side effects include light-headedness, nausea, skin rash and constipation.
I understand excision of a skin lesion has the following specific risks and limitations
• My wound may become infected, with redness, swelling and discharge. I may need antibiotics to treat this.
• I will have a scar where the lesion was removed. This usually fades with time, but may always be visible.
I understand a split or full thickness skin graft has the following specific risks and limitations:
• The skin graft may fail to ‘take’ (survive).
• The donor site may itch during the healing phase, but this will settle as healing progresses.
• I will have a permanent scar at the donor site, which will initially be quite red, but this will fade in time.
• The donor site or the recipient site may become infected, slowing or preventing healing and deepening the damage.
• The skin graft may be too thin or a poor colour match.
• The graft site may contract as it heals, with a thickened scar (keloid) and/ or limitation of movement if the scar crosses a joint.
I understand some of the above risks are more likely if I smoke, am diabetic or have high blood pressure.

■ I acknowledge that I have discussed with the plastic surgeon any significant risks and complications specific to my individual circumstances that I have considered in deciding to have this operation.
■ I agree to any other additional procedures considered necessary in the judgement of the plastic surgeon during this operation.
■ I agree to the disposal by the hospital authorities of any tissues that may be removed during the procedure. I understand that some tissues or samples may be kept as part of my hospital records.
■ I understand that a doctor other than the plastic surgeon may perform the procedure.
■ I have received a copy of this form to take home with me.

■ If a needlestick/ sharps injury occurs to staff during any operation I give my permission for blood to be taken and tested for HIV and other blood borne disorders. I understand I will be advised and counselled as soon as practicable after the operation if this has been necessary.
■ I have given the patient an opportunity to ask questions and I have answered these.
I confirm I have accurately interpreted the contents of this form and the related conversations between the patient and the doctor
Interpreter's signature
Date
